comments.raw_text:
Right now, the localization entities are scattered across a variety of files:
- http://mxr.mozilla.org/comm-central/source/mozilla/toolkit/locales/en-US/chrome/global/textcontext.dtd
- http://mxr.mozilla.org/comm-central/source/mozilla/browser/locales/en-US/chrome/browser/browser.dtd#510

These should be all moved into a separate file so that in other apps, such as Thunderbird, we don't have to redefine the entities from browser.dtd. We cannot move them all into textcontext.dtd because that file also contains other entities which are redefined inside Thunderbird, and whose access keys are different.

I suggest toolkit/locales/en-US/chrome/global/spell.dtd as the name of the file. Does that sound alright? I'd like to make that happen after the string freeze.
comments.creator: jonathan.protzenko@gmail.com
